article.headline: Detroit 60, Northeastern 51
article.story: DETROIT (AP) -- Ryvon Coville had 16 points and a career-high 16 rebounds Friday to help Detroit break a four-game losing streak with a 60-51 win over Northeastern. Coville, the nation's fourth-leading rebounder, scored 10 points in the first 10 minutes of the second half and posted his ninth double-double in 11 games. The Titans (3-8) took control with a 16-2 run midway through the second half. Eugene Spates and Adrian Martinez each had 11 points for the Huskies (3-7), who were seeking back-to-back victories for the first time this season. Northeastern missed five straight shots during the Titans' decisive run and was outscored 34-16 in the paint. Detroit scored 13 points off the Huskies' 17 turnovers. Brandon Cotton also had 16 points and Jon Goode added 10 for the Titans, who led by as many as 20 points late in the game before coach Perry Watson cleared the bench. Bennet Davis had 10 for the Huskies.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
